original: ERICSON, Håkan Hang Kristian, Konteramiral, förutv Statsråd, Stockholm, f Sthlm 16/2 68 av grhdl E E o Augusta Lundeberg, gm Elin Gadelius. Klara elem.sk, N Latin, uljt v fi 89, AIHS h k 94—98, arméns skjutsk 93. Lär KSHS 02—14, KSS 05—13, tjg i marin-förv 98—04 o 09—14, ch marinförv ar t. avd 14, 1. f laggad j ut 04—07, komm. kapt 2. gr 11, 1. fr 16, statsr o ch sjöförsv.dep 30/3—19/10 17, ommendör v fi 17, i res 21, k.amiral 28, tji flott 18, adj h Konungen 11—17, överadj 17. Vkst dir Sthlms Red.AB Svea 18—34. Led sjökr.mtrlkomm 07—09, fl.stat.komm 08, sjö-mansk org.komm 08, sekr parlam försv.komm 07—10, lia kamm 11—19 (statsutsk, h), led kustförsv.komm 14, lotsv löneregl.komm 13— 14, jvgsrådet sed. 26. Ordf Sv Allm Sjöf.frn sed. 26, i komm f Sjöbef Pens.kassa o i dess styr, styr.ordf Sthlms Red.AB Svea, AB Finnboda Varv, AB Red.agenturen, Ångf.AB Göta Kanal, Swedberg & Kronberg AB, Frostenson & Larsson AB, AB Aldebaran, Arcturus, Antares, Andromeda, ordf Sv avd f skand sjö-m.hem i främm hamnar. Frn Sv Sjöf.mus i Sthlm, Sv Red.frn ö kr, Svensk-Nederl Frn, Frn 68 års män, v. ordf Sv Redarefrn, Land & Sjö, v. pres balt o internat mar.konf, medl Sjöh. mus nmd, Sv frn Internat Sjörätt, Sur-taxkomm, komm f underhandl m ombordanst (ordf 40), Idun mfl in- o utl samm.slutn. GV:s Jmt, KSOlkl, KVOlkl, RNO, StkLettSO, StOffNedONO m sv, KDDOlgr, KBadZLO2kl, KFrHL, KNOS:tOO, RRS:sStO2kl, Off ItS :t-MLO, TMO4kl, LKRVA, HedLöS.
translated: ERICSON, Håkan Hang Kristian, Rear Admiral, former Minister of State, Stockholm, b. Sthlm 16/2 68 to Count E E and Augusta Lundeberg, m. Elin Gadelius. Elementary school in Klara, Latin school in Norrmalm, graduated from the Military Academy in 1898, Army shooting school in 1893. Taught at the Royal Military Academy 1902-1914, Royal Swedish Naval Staff College 1905-1913, served in naval administration 1898-1904 and 1909-1914, head of naval administration in 1914, 1st lieutenant from 1904-1907, promoted to captain in 1911, commander of the 2nd destroyer flotilla from 1916, Minister and Chief of the Naval Defense Department from 30/3-19/10 1917, commander-in-chief of the Finnish Navy in 1917, retired in 1921, promoted to Vice Admiral in 1928, dismissed from the navy in 1918, aide-de-camp to the King from 1911-1917, senior aide-de-camp from 1917. Acting director of Stockholm Rederi AB Svea from 1918-1934. Member of the naval construction committee from 1907-1909, fleet state committee in 1908, sailors' organization committee in 1908, secretary of the parliamentary defense committee from 1907-1910, member of the legislative assembly from 1911-1919 (chairman of the committee on defense, 2nd chamber), member of the coastal defense committee in 1914, pilot salary regulation committee from 1913-1914, member of the railway council since 1926. Chairman of the Swedish Maritime Association since 1926, member of the board of the Naval Pension Fund and its steering committee, Chairman of Stockholm Rederi AB Svea, AB Finnboda Varv, AB Red.agenturen, Ångf.AB Göta Kanal, Swedberg & Kronberg AB, Frostenson & Larsson AB, AB Aldebaran, Arcturus, Antares, Andromeda, chairman of the Swedish section of the Scandinavian Maritime Preservation Society in foreign ports. Member of the Swedish Maritime Museum in Stockholm, Swedish Red Cross Eastern Fleet, Swedish-Dutch Association, 68 Men's Association, Deputy Chairman of the Swedish Shipowners' Association, Land & Sea, Vice President of the Baltic and International Maritime Conference, member of the Sea History Museum Board, Swedish section of the International Maritime Law, Surcharge Committee, negotiating committee for crew members (chairman in 1940), member of the Idun international and national association. Grand Cross of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Commander First Class of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Dutch Order of Orange-Nassau, Officer of the Order of the Sword, Knight of the Royal Norwegian Order, Knight of 2nd Class of the Estonian Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, Officer of the Liberation of Belgium, Commander 2nd Class of the Order of the Star of the Republic of Turkey, Officer of the Italian Order of Cultural Merit, 4th Class of the Order of the Egyptian Nile, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Naval Sciences, Commander of the Legion of Honour.
